page.title: 02Development of Fenland
page.content: More than half of our area is covered in fenland.The ground is very flat and Farcet stands on a ridge of higher griund about sixty feet above the fields.Before the fen was drained, there was marshy,swampy ground near the village.This was rich in bird life and many fish swam in the muddy water.The higher,stoney ridge was a dry route between{Yaxley}and{ {Stanground.} The fen is formed of peat and began to be drained in the early seventeenth century with the dutchman{Cornelius {Vermuyden}as engineer, and continued at intervals until about a century ago, when Farcet Fen was fully drained.The drainage and shrinking of the peat makes the level of fields low. The{Pig Water}gives water access to other parts of the country.
